group_1.textRight: Huh, so that's what you were@thinking about.

group_1.textLeft: A long time ago, Papa had gone to@Rabi's hometown.
Rabi was going through a difficult time@back then,
and it was Papa who saved her.

group_1.textRight: So she feels like owes him, then.

group_1.textLeft: Since then, Rabi has had utmost respect@for Papa,
but I, his daughter, do not have@character like him, so I feel awful.
If I don't take on his ways, I will eventually@become hated and lose this family.

group_1.textRight: I don't really get anything about this...@but it sounds hard.

group_1.textLeft: For worrying about something you don't@understand, "it sounds hard" is worth a 100.

group_1.textRight: You think there's anyone in@my neighborhood that has character?

group_1.textLeft: If there is anyone near you, Mikage...
your older sister has a mature air@about her.
That may be one characteristic of hers.

group_1.textRight: Big Sis? Then why don't you go ask her?

group_1.textLeft: I think that is a good idea.
I feel that it is better to consult@someone older.

group_1.textRight: I think she's at the Coordinator's shop@right now, so I'll watch the house.

group_1.textLeft: Thank you very much.@Then I will be going now.

group_1.textRight: Excuse the disturbance.

group_1.textLeft: Oh my! Nayuta!@Thank you for always watching Mii.

group_1.textRight: Not at all, it is my pleasure.

group_1.textLeft: What brings you in today - a Coordination?

group_1.textRight: No, there is something I must@ask you about...

group_1.textLeft: Sure, whatever you want to talk about.@I'll go make some tea.

group_1.textRight: ...That is what I had spoken to Rabi@about yesterday...

group_1.textLeft: I see now. So you want to build character.

group_1.textRight: I don't know what I would do if Rabi@left the house.
And we are so close in age, yet it is so@difficult to get along with her.

group_1.textLeft: Hmm...unfortunately I'm not aware@of an answer either myself.

group_1.textRight: Does character come naturally to you...?

group_1.textLeft: I've never heard of having character.
I'm just a little mature, that's all.
Sometimes people ask me,@"Are you really seventeen?"

group_1.textRight: [chara:103701:effect_emotion_surprise_0][se:7226_shock]What?! You are seventeen years old?!

group_1.textLeft: Oh, it happened again...
But, if I do have any character,
maybe it's related to my mindset for@working as a Coordinator.

group_1.textRight: Your mindset as a Coordinator...you say?

group_1.textLeft: This is something my teacher@had told me,
but to work as an Coordinator, you need to be able@to understand the minds of those you work with,
and take care of them with@a broad mind.

group_1.textRight: A broad mind...I feel like I am getting@closer to the word called character.
(Papa was also tolerant of others.)
S-so what did you do to accomplish that?

group_1.textLeft: I didn't really do anything special.
If I had to say, I suppose it was just@being kind and caring.
"If you're bad at this, you're going to have@a hard time as an Coordinator,"
is what my teacher told me.

group_1.textRight: Kind and caring...
Mature, composed character...
So it's kind and caring broad-mindedness!
